Entries.default: You recognize the familiar robes of Fyonlecg, his back to you, arms outstretched to either side as he channels the incredible reserves of ambient essence at the heart of Wael's titan.
"You are but a burglar. These archives shall add your soul to their catalog."
"Truly? That's the titan's key? That's, it's preposterous!"

"Wait, I recognize this. How famil-"

The robed figure spins on you.
"No. Another outsider. Seems the Oracle needs to tighten her guard."
"Be on your guard. This man is a wizard."
"This one holds himself with a measure of authority. I don't like it."
"Name yourself, then. Out with it now."
"I am [Player Name], the Watcher of Caed Nua."
"I'm here at the behest of the Circle of Archmagi."
"Step away from big, gray, and mouthy before someone gets hurt."
"I came here looking for Maura. You seem to have found her first."
"You murdered her! I won't let you get away with it!"
"What in Wael's name is that thing?"
"Here and now? I very much doubt that."
He scoffs. "Do you think me a fool? Maerwald is the Watcher of Caed Nua, for whatever good that ruined hovel has done him."
"Maura believed herself entitled to power beyond her ken. I disabused her of the notion."
"Ah. This is the Memory Hoarder. One of the Oracle's little projects. It subdues those collected by the Hand Occult."
"But don't presume I failed to notice your attempted deflection. Who are you? Why are you here?"
[Attack] "This ends now. Prepare yourself."

"Pardon?"

He looks between you and the multi-faced entity.
"Are you, now? I hope they've at least had the decency to compensate you rather than simply coercing you into their employ."
"Farewell, Watcher of Caed Nua."
"Maerwald died years ago. I claimed his keep."

"Years? Years then."

He gingerly runs a gloved finger along his mask.
"Little matter."
"Blades out, everyone!"
"I knew it would come to this eventually." Gritting her teeth, Fassina draws her weapon.
"Aw, fuck me, cap. Incoming!"
"Apology not accepted." Maia reaches for her weapon. Ishiza's feather bristle with anticipation.
"Aye, now you be speaking my language, cap!" Serafen licks his lips.
"I hope you're square with your maker, 'cause you're gonna be seeing them real soon."
"Fixed it up real nice, too. Can't say it's much to look at now, though."
"Ah, it seems the Hoarder stirs. Pleasant dreams, outsider."
"Ah. Oh gods. I see - no - I feel - everything!"
"Fyonlecg!"
"Are you trying to get us all killed?!"
"I'm looking forward to slicing you into little wizard bits, asshole."
"It's your story that ends here, I'm afraid. And none shall remember it."
[Wait and observe.]

He stiffens. "It seems we have a guest."

He turns towards you. Unmasked, the elf's features seem half smeared away as if by the hand of a sculptor.
The archmage spins on you. Unmasked, the elf's features seem half smeared away as if by the hand of a sculptor.
"I'm afraid that we - that I - cannot allow you to interfere, [Player Name]. We've come entirely too close to turn away now."
"You're close to what, exactly? What are you trying to accomplish?"
"Listen to yourself. You're losing your identity! You're being subsumed into - whatever this is!"
"Communion?"
[Attack] "Gods, I'm looking forward to killing you."

"Communion."

Like a leaf held to a flame, his smile curls at both ends.
"All of the knowledge in these halls - all of the memories - it all descends, flowing into this titanic form."
"I was forgetting myself long before I entered the titan. But through the titan I can restore me."
"Never heard of you."
"I can say with great certainty that history knows of no such archmage."
"Oh, you're that Fyonlecg! Why didn't you say so before?"
<ispeech>Tell us, interloper. What do you recall?</ispeech>
<ispeech>All knew us! For the spells that bore our name if nothing else! Fyonlecg's Wall of Flames. Fyonlecg's Wall of Many Colors. Fyonlecg's Pristine Barrier.</ispeech>
"Very impressive. So what happened to bring low such an illustrious personage?"
"So wall stuff, mostly."
"Well now those spells are nameless, and you're nothing."
"How did the Hand Occult get involved?"
"Fyonlecg was one of the foremost figures on the Circle of Archmagi. A genius who vanished mysteriously."
"You were responsible for that one spell, right? The one with your name on it?"
"Okay, maybe not."
The Oracle's eyestalks quiver as concentrated frustration washes over you.
"He wore a mask?"
Serafen side eyes you and shakes his head.
The Oracle's eyestalks quiver in pleasure.
<ispeech>Our repute survives, even among the unlearned.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Our beloved spellwork. Our Wall of Many Colors. Our Wall of Flames. Our Impenetrable Bulwark. That one turned the Circle's heads.</ispeech>
The Oracle's eyestalks snap sharply still, each focused intently on you. The great central orb narrows.

<ispeech>No. We will be remembered. We demand the recognition we have earned.</ispeech>

Its anger strikes your face like the heat from a blast furnace.

<ispeech>Wall stuff? Wall stuff!</ispeech>

Raw hostility charges the air.
<ispeech>If these are the youth, we weep for Eora.</ispeech>
"If you think the Watcher's bad, you should meet Tayn."
"Ever the academic." Fassina tuts and shakes her head.
<ispeech>We - I - I joined the Hand Occult. Served Wael faithfully and became initiated into ever deeper circles of revelation.</ispeech>
<ispeech>They appointed me weyc. The high magician, seer, and arcanist. That's when we - when I - uncovered the truth.</ispeech>

"Maura?"

The mask shifts slightly.

"Maura spoke true after all."

Shaking his head, he shrugs.
"Allow me an idle moment's curiosity. Have you heard of the Archmage Fyonlecg?"
"It hasn't come up."
"I'm doing this for the good of the Deadfire."
"Having friends among the archmages can't hurt."
"I'm not here to discuss coin!"
"Little bit the former, a little bit the latter."
"How unsurprising."
"Ah. One for heroics, then, are you?"
"You must not've made the acquaintance of many archmages."
"Ah, extortion then. Apologies if I hit a sore spot."
"Right here, right now. We're an impulsive bunch."
"This prat be needing a right proper killing."
[Attack] "Something tells me I'm going to enjoy this."
"Archmages don't have friends. Only pawns and rivals."
"None of your concern."
The masked figure stares silently at you for several seconds before acquiescing with an almost imperceptible shrug.
"A singularly unpleasant process, I assure you."
"Not even a little."
"There's not been an archmage by that name in the recorded history of the Circle."
"That's you, I presume?"
"Only in the notes full of crazy I've found all over this prison."
"Does it matter?"
"Oh yeah. There was a book about his exploits among the shelves down below."

"That cannot be. Years or no, the Hand could not have expunged so much so quickly."

He stares at his open hands.
He exhales a prolonged sigh.

"Nothing could matter more."

He leans forward.
[Shake your head.]
He exhales a prolonged sigh.
"You truly do not recognize me."
"I studied the history of the Circle extensively during my time at Bragganhyl, and your name never came up."
"Arkemyr never mentioned the name, and he spoke about his colleagues obsessively." Fassina rolls her eyes.
"Then the effect is not localized. Neither limited to mine own mind, nor to Maura's."
"Unless, perhaps... Could the Hand Occult have developed some manner of contagion?"
"What are you talking about?"
"Probably. I've a bit of a tingle in my throat myself."
[Wait for him to finish.]
[Attack] "Let me simplify things."
His quiet chuckle is largely muffled by his mask.
"You suspect some effect has caused people to forget you?"
His attention snaps back to you, his expression concealed behind his mask.
"No, no. That wouldn't affect text. But have I confirmed text has actually been impacted? No, I've only witnesses - and not witnesses without bias."

"Such a thing is certainly possible. We may have even read of this one in the past, only to have our memory of it suppressed."

She frowns at the robed man.
"I knew someone once who'd been forgotten by the world."

"My apologies. It's all rather disorienting. So let's not leave you to complicate matters further."

He withdraws a rod from among his robes.
"Farewell, stranger."
"There we are, friend. Open up, now, and receive me."
"Didn't I turn you into worms?"
"You didn't tell me that you killed Maura. You could have saved me a lot of time."
"Watcher of Caed Nua. Herald of Berath. Champion of the Hunt. Duskspeaker."
"Watcher of Caed Nua. Herald of Berath. Duskspeaker."
"Watcher of Caed Nua. Herald of Berath. Champion of the Hunt."
"Watcher of Caed Nua. Herald of Berath."
"But seriously. I thought you were worms."
"And now I'm thirsty. Thanks."
"You overcame a false Fyonlecg. A simulacrum. A phantasm. Simple enough spellwork."

<ispeech>We recall everything. Everything we've ever known. Everything we've never known.</ispeech>

The wizard's thoughts echo among your own, pounding against your mind like an ogre against a closed gate.
"How did you know those titles?"
"Knowledge flows through us, like water through a pipe, over a wheel, and into a reservoir."
"Last I checked, phantasms were conjured essence, not conjured worms."
"False or no, you're responsible for Maura's death."
"To what end?"
"Oh, we know. We know - so many things."
"Is that why you're performing this ritual of command?"
"If you think you can feed your essence to the titan and assume control of it, you're going to be very disappointed. "
"The titan's soul is like an ocean. Deep and tumultuous. You'll be overwhelmed."
"I'm not sure he means to compel this creature at all..."
"You have my back, team? I think this is about to get bloody."
"I don't think we have much of a choice if we intend to get out of here alive..."
"We've faced worse than a man in a fancy dress. He's not going to animate any statues, is he?"
"I keep thinking we'll find that one reasonable adversary. Not today." Maia signals to Ishiza and readies her weapon.
"We do not know what he is capable of, Watcher. Prepare for anything."

"Something about this be thrice twisted, cap. Like a godsdamned maelstrom."

He clutches the side of his head.
"It always gets bloody, does it not? For once I truly believe our task is a necessary one." Tekēhu exhales slowly, moving like the water as the wizard closes in.
"I almost thought you'd never ask."
"Merla! We may be too late to prevent this, captain."
"Right behind you, Watcher!"
"This fiend is a distortion that begs to be corrected. Let us be done with it quickly."
"I will not leave your side."
"Ja. Let us end this wizard's prattle, Duskspeaker."
"I got your back, Watcher. The rest of these idiots are on their own."
"The me, too, that we were before. I feel it there. Pulsing like a heart."
"We can help you, Fyonlecg, but not if you lose yourself."
"I can't let you do this."
[Attack] "This ends now!"

<ispeech>We recall young Fyonlecg, promising apprentice of the Cythwood. Indomitable Fyonlecg, the Arcane Knight. Fyonlecg the Unspoiled, Archmage of the Circle. Fyonlecg, Weyc of the Hand Occult.</ispeech>

The names, titles, and memories - and the emotions that accompany each - break upon you like the shore.
"The Leaden Key got something like this, Aloth? Maybe turn you into a big floating crown?"
"Have you forgotten that this all started with your god climbing out from the basement?"
"Focus, both of you. This is not Copperlane."
<ispeech>You know our work? Strange. This is a forgotten place. A sanctum for lost things.</ispeech>
The entity's huge central eye swivels in its socket to focus on you. The pupil dilates, drinking you in.
[Attack] "Time to die!"
The entity's huge central eye swivels in its socket to focus on you. The pupil dilates, drinking you in.
[Attack] "He got stabbed in the eyeball!"
The entity blinks as you advance.
"His transformation has done little for his stability of mind."
"Belfetto. Now he is upset as well as unstable."
The Oracle's eyestalks snap sharply still, each focused intently on you. The great central orb narrows.
<ispeech>We will not be silenced. Wael will not bury us as they did the ones who came before.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You hold it, too. We see it, the secret, shining in your mind. The great lie. A star set within a blank firmament.</ispeech>
"What do you mean, those who came before?"
"The great lie?"
"None of this matters. I can't let you have the titan."
[Attack] "I've heard enough."
<ispeech>The birth of the gods.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You don't believe the Engwithans were first, do you? Or alone? You already know of the Huana. There were others.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You've no choice in the matter, little interloper. We are become one.</ispeech>

<ispeech>We cannot allow your egress. Too many secrets taint you, as they tainted Fyonlecg. You must be purified.</ispeech>

The creature rises.
<ispeech>Engwith established global influence, not eternal dominion.</ispeech>
"Tell me when to hit him, Watcher, and I will do it gladly."
"That's very advanced, actually-" Voice shaking, he stares at you, wide-eyed and frightened.
"Sounds a bit like your history, Aloth, give or take a few titles."
"I am nothing like him."
"Watcher, do you think he means-"
"Shush, Rekke. Now is not the time." Aloth presses his hand against the young man's mouth, willing him to silence.
